World.headline: START is over: US and Russia no longer have limits on nuclear arsenals
World.summary: The New START Treaty, the last remaining arms control agreement between the US and Russia, has officially ended. This signifies that both nuclear powers no longer have binding limits on their strategic nuclear arsenals, raising global security concerns.
key_points: New START Treaty between US and Russia has concluded.
No more binding limits on strategic nuclear arsenals for both nations.
Raises significant concerns for international security.

World.headline: Ukraine and Russia swap 314 prisoners of war after Abu Dhabi talks
World.summary: In a significant humanitarian gesture, Ukraine and Russia exchanged 314 prisoners of war following talks held in Abu Dhabi. This mutual repatriation saw 157 soldiers returned to each side, marking a rare moment of cooperation in the ongoing conflict.
key_points: Ukraine and Russia exchanged 314 prisoners of war.
The swap occurred after talks in Abu Dhabi.
157 soldiers were returned to each country.

World.headline: Deals with EU, US good sign for world stability: PM Modi in Rajya Sabha
World.summary: Prime Minister Modi stated in Rajya Sabha that upcoming trade deals with the EU and US signify stability for the world. His comments suggest differences with the US have been resolved, with a formal announcement expected soon.
key_points: PM Modi sees EU and US trade deals as positive for global stability.

World.headline: Fearing ‘unpleasant act’ by oppn, asked PM to skip Lok Sabha: Birla
World.summary: Lok Sabha Speaker Birla revealed he advised PM Modi to skip a parliamentary session due to fears of an "unpleasant act" by the opposition. This highlights heightened political tensions and decorum concerns within the Indian parliament.
key_points: PM Modi advised by Speaker Birla to skip Lok Sabha session.

World.headline: Why PM Modi's efforts to build ties with next-gen Arab leaders matters

key_points: PM Modi is cultivating personal friendships with next-gen Arab leaders.

Aims to counter Pakistan's influence in the Middle East.

World.headline: Married woman can’t claim rape on false marriage promise: Supreme Court
World.summary: India's Supreme Court ruled that a married woman cannot claim rape based on a false promise of marriage, especially if she was ineligible to marry due to an existing marriage. The ruling led to the quashing of criminal proceedings against a lawyer accused by a woman advocate.
key_points: Supreme Court ruled married women cannot claim rape on false marriage promises.
Applies when the woman is ineligible for marriage due to existing marital status.
Quashed proceedings against a lawyer accused under such circumstances.

World.headline: Police can’t arrest an accused simply to ask questions: Supreme Court
World.summary: The Supreme Court stated that police cannot arrest an accused solely for questioning, emphasizing the new Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023. Under Section 35(3) of the law, a notice to the accused is generally required for offenses punishable with up to 7 years imprisonment.
key_points: Supreme Court limits police power to arrest for questioning.
Highlights Section 35(3) of Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023.
Notice to accused is mandatory for offenses with up to 7 years imprisonment.

World.headline: India may raise Zakir Naik issue again during PM’s Malaysia visit
World.summary: India is expected to revisit the extradition of Zakir Naik during PM Modi's visit to Malaysia, despite Malaysia's stance that the case is a judicial matter. The visit will also cover enhancing cooperation in various strategic areas like trade, defence, and digital technologies.
key_points: India likely to discuss Zakir Naik's extradition with Malaysia.
Malaysia maintains the case is a judicial matter.

World.headline: EU countries seal deal on €90bn loan for Ukraine funded by joint debt
World.summary: European Union member states have finalized a deal to provide Ukraine with a substantial €90 billion loan, which will be funded through joint debt issuance. This financial package represents a significant commitment to support Ukraine's stability and recovery amidst ongoing conflict.

Loan will be financed through joint debt.

Business.headline: India import of Russian crude in December lowest since February 2025

Aims to reduce confusion in diabetes testing and diagnosis.

Health.headline: Diabetes diet alert: Expert reveals these common foods spike your blood sugar more than sugar itself
Health.summary: A diabetes expert warns that certain common foods can elevate blood sugar levels more significantly than direct sugar consumption. This alert provides crucial dietary insights for individuals managing diabetes or seeking to prevent it.
key_points: Expert warns about common foods spiking blood sugar more than sugar.
Crucial dietary advice for diabetes management.
Aids individuals in preventing or controlling diabetes.

Health.headline: Your urine could signal danger: Doctor explains what to watch for
Health.summary: A doctor highlights how changes in urine characteristics can serve as important indicators of underlying health issues, explaining specific signs to monitor. This information empowers individuals to recognize potential health risks early.
key_points: Doctor explains urine changes can signal health dangers.
Identifies specific signs to watch out for.
Aims to help early recognition of potential health problems.

Health.headline: Are you a night owl? New study links late nights to heart disease
Health.summary: A new study has established a link between being a "night owl" and an increased risk of heart disease, suggesting that late sleep patterns can have significant health implications. This research highlights the importance of circadian rhythms for cardiovascular health.
key_points: New study links "night owl" sleep patterns to heart disease risk.
Suggests late nights have significant health implications.
Emphasizes the role of circadian rhythms in cardiovascular health.

Health.headline: Experimental oral drug lowers ‘bad’ cholesterol by 60%, study finds
Health.summary: An experimental oral drug has been found to reduce "bad" cholesterol levels by an impressive 60%, according to a new study. This breakthrough offers a promising new avenue for managing high cholesterol and reducing cardiovascular risk.
key_points: Experimental oral drug lowers "bad" cholesterol by 60%.
Finding comes from a new study.
Offers a promising new treatment for high cholesterol.

Health.headline: Following this diet may reduce stroke risk among women
Health.summary: Adhering to a specific dietary pattern has been shown to potentially reduce the risk of stroke among women, according to new research. This study provides valuable insights into preventative health measures through nutrition.
key_points: A specific diet may reduce stroke risk in women.
Finding is based on new research.
Offers dietary guidance for stroke prevention in women.

Health.headline: French assisted dying bill back on the table after Senate rejection
Health.summary: France's assisted dying bill is once again under consideration after being rejected by the Senate, sparking renewed debate on euthanasia and end-of-life care. The legislative body is revisiting the controversial proposal amid ongoing public and political discussion.
key_points: French assisted dying bill is being reconsidered.
It was previously rejected by the Senate.
Rekindles debate on euthanasia and end-of-life care.
